Storage

Class Task

  • Object
    • Storage.Task

  • public class Task
extends Object
    A Task object contains attributes to store a task's unique ID, description, due date and time, scheduled starting date and time, scheduled ending date and time, relevant tags to ease searching and categorizing, completion state, and deletion state.
    Author:
    Pierce Anderson Fu

      Constructor.

      Cloning constructor.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Task

        public Task(String name,
            DateTime due,
            DateTime start,
            DateTime end,
            List<String> tags)
        Constructor. Used when creating a new Task. Increments ID counter.
        Parameters:
        name - Task description.
        due - Due date and time, format: DD/MM/YYYY HHMM
        start - Scheduled start date and time, format: DD/MM/YYYY HHMM
        end - Scheduled end date and time, format: DD/MM/YYYY HHMM
        tags - To aid searching and categorizing. Each tag contains #.

      • Task

        public Task(Task task)
        Cloning constructor. Does not increment ID counter.
        Parameters:
        task - The existing Task object to clone attributes by value from.

    • Method Detail

      • getFullInfo

        public String getFullInfo()
        Converts Task object to a single String to write to system file. Parameter tags are added to aid in parsing text when reading from file.
        Returns:
        String to write to system file for storage.

      • getSummary

        public String getSummary()
        Stores searchable Task attributes in a single String. To be processed by a search function matching search terms.
        Returns:
        String containing searchable Task attributes.

      • wipeTask

        public void wipeTask()
        Reduces ID counter when Task object is to be wiped.

      • wipeAllTasks

        public static void wipeAllTasks()
        Resets ID counter when all Tasks objects are wiped.

        public int getId()
